verses.text: 大祭司約書亞的異象耶和華又使我看見大祭司約書亞站在耶和華的使者面前，撒但也站在約書亞右邊控告他。

words.note: Lit. 'great sacrifice manager'
Lit. 'strange image'
Name for God in the Old Testament.
Lit. 'great sacrifice manager'
Name for God in the Old Testament.
Often refers to an angel in biblical context.

verses.text: 耶和華對撒但說：「撒但哪！耶和華斥責你，那揀選了耶路撒冷的耶和華斥責你。這個人不是從火中抽出來的一根柴嗎？」

words.note: Name for God in the Old Testament.
Name for God in the Old Testament.
A strong form of criticism or correction.
Often used in religious contexts for divine choosing.
Name for God in the Old Testament.
A strong form of criticism or correction.
In biblical context, 'brand plucked from fire' (a rescued remnant).

verses.text: 那時，約書亞穿著污穢的衣服，站在使者的面前。

words.note: Refers to ritual impurity or moral defilement.
Often refers to an angel in biblical context.

verses.text: 使者吩咐那些侍立在他面前的說：「你們要脫去他污穢的衣服。」又對約書亞說：「看哪！我已經除去了你的罪孽，要給你穿上華美的禮服。」

words.note: Often refers to an angel in biblical context.
A formal way to give orders.
Formal term for attending a superior.
Here nominalizes the preceding phrase: 'those who stood before him'.
Refers to ritual impurity or moral defilement.
An exclamation drawing attention, common in scripture.
Often refers to inherent evil or grave sin.
Describes something grand and beautiful, often ceremonial.
Special attire for religious or formal occasions.

verses.text: 我說：「你們要把潔淨的冠冕戴在他的頭上。」他們就把潔淨的冠冕戴在他的頭上，又給他穿上華美的衣服。那時，耶和華的使者正在旁邊站著。

words.note: Indicates the object is acted upon or disposed of.
Refers to ritual purity or moral cleanliness.
A symbol of royalty, authority, or honor.
Indicates a consequence or immediate succession.
Indicates the object is acted upon or disposed of.
Refers to ritual purity or moral cleanliness.
A symbol of royalty, authority, or honor.
Describes something grand and beautiful, often ceremonial.
Name for God in the Old Testament.
Often refers to an angel in biblical context.
Indicates an action is ongoing.

verses.text: 耶和華的使者勸戒約書亞說：

words.note: Often refers to angels in biblical context.

verses.text: 「萬軍之耶和華這樣說：『你若遵行我的道，謹守我的吩咐，你就必治理我的家，看守我的院子，我必賜你特權，可以在這些侍立在我面前的使者中間自由出入。

words.note: A divine title emphasizing God's sovereignty over armies/heavenly hosts.
Often used for obeying God's will or commandments.
In this context, refers to God's ways or commandments.
Often used for divine commands in the Bible.
In this context, refers to God's temple or people.
Formal term for serving while standing near a superior.
Often refers to angels in biblical context.

words.definition: come and go, enter and exit

verses.text: 大祭司約書亞啊！你和坐在你面前的眾同伴都要聽，（他們都是預表將來奇事的人，）我必使我的僕人，就是大衛的苗裔出生。

words.note: The chief priest of ancient Israel.
Often precedes a noun to indicate plurality or multitude.
Refers to a type or foreshadowing of a future event/person in Christian theology.
Often used for miracles or signs from God.
Often refers to God's servant or a prophet in the Bible.
Refers to a royal or noble lineage, often used for the Messiah.

verses.text: 看我在約書亞面前所立的石頭，在這一塊石頭上有七眼。看哪！我要親自雕琢這石頭（這是萬軍之耶和華的宣告）。在一日之內，我要除去這地的罪孽。

words.note: Indicates the object of a verb or preposition.
Used as a locative suffix meaning 'on top of'.
An exclamation of attention or wonder, common in biblical texts.
Refers to careful, intricate carving or shaping.
A divine title emphasizing God's sovereignty over armies/heavenly hosts.
Often used for a formal, authoritative statement, especially divine.
Classical Chinese possessive/connective, similar to '的'.
Used as a locative suffix meaning 'within'.
Strong term for sin or wrongdoing with serious consequences.

verses.text: 到那日（這是萬軍之耶和華的宣告），你們各人要邀請自己的鄰舍來，坐在葡萄樹下和無花果樹下。』」

words.note: A divine title emphasizing God's sovereignty over armies/heavenly hosts.
Often used for a formal, authoritative statement, especially divine.
Classic term for a neighbor, frequently used in biblical contexts.
Often a symbol of peace and prosperity in the Bible.
Used as a locative suffix meaning 'under'.
Often a symbol of peace and prosperity alongside the grapevine.
Used as a locative suffix meaning 'under'.
